intro: Inula vernonioides, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of tubular disc flowers, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. Inula vernonioides is typically found in open habitats such as prairies and woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
